Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment:
Hm, it’d be better if $PATH was respected, otherwise this will not work on systems where Xephyr is not in /usr/bin (perhaps NixOS? not 100% sure though).

Instead, we could just run Xephyr -help and check if that exited with 0.

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: Also, this needs to go into a separate check anyway, because the error message suggests running “make” is the fix, but it clearly isn’t :). It should talk about installing the xserver-xephyr package.

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: The rename I’d do in a follow-up commit. Documentation and removing XDummy can go into the same commit :).
